intro: Conohoria ulmifolia, commonly known as the willow-leaf conohoria, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that resemble those of willow trees. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Conohoria ulmifolia is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
